dt: {bc}a quality that deserves blame or lacks merit {bc}{sx|fault||}, {sx|defect||}
{bc}a mark usually entailing a loss of privilege given to an offender

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French & Medieval Latin; Anglo-French {it}demerite{/it}, from Medieval Latin {it}demeritum{/it}, from neuter of {it}demeritus{/it}, past participle of {it}demerēre{/it} to be undeserving of, from Latin, to earn, from {it}de-{/it} + {it}merēre{/it} to merit
shortdef: a quality that deserves blame or lacks merit : fault, defect
